intro: Symphionema abrotanoides, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant is known for its milky sap, which contains various bioactive compounds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in semi-arid regions. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
